sentence.idiomatic: If I had the money, I would like to go to Beijing.
If I don't have beef, I go to the department store to buy it.
If I don't have money, can I use a credit card?
Next year I want to move to England.
I don't know where he moved to.
If you move to Japan, I'll be really upset.
I don't know if now is convenient or not.
Mr. Li said today at three o'clock is not very convenient.
When is most convenient?
This department store's things are all very inexpensive.
Do you often go shopping at department stores?
I rather like to go shopping at department stores.
This place has everything.
In his home he has everything.
This restaurant has every kind of food.
I like Thai food, but the flavor is a bit spicy.
I like Beijing, but the weather is a bit cold.
The food here is very good, but it's a bit expensive.
Other than Shanghai, I've never been anywhere else.
I don't know any others besides Mr. Li.
I don't like any other kind of meat other than other than beef.
I don't want to eat here. Let's go to another restaurant.
I don't want to buy this cell phone. Don't you have any others?
He's not Shanghainese. He comes from another place.
What place is this?
The place I live is very convenient.
Excuse me, where is the subway station?
My boyfriend is rather good looking.
Shopping in Shanghai is rather expensive.
Is he rather smart?
This price is not reasonable.
I think that this computer is too expensive. The price is unreasonable.
Do you feel that the price is reasonable?
I must study Chinese because I'd like to go to China next year.
We must work hard.
I'm too fat. I must lose weight.
Can I pay in cash?
Sorry, you can't use a credit card.
I didn't bring money. Can I use a credit card?
Do you want to eat beef or pork? Both are OK.
Do you like to sing or to dance? Both are fine.
Mrs. Li, if I move to Shanghai is buying things convenient or not?
Shanghai has many department stores. In the department stores you can find anything. But the price is a little expensive.
Outside of the department stores, are there any other places to shop?
There are many markets in Shanghai. Prices are more reasonable there.
In Shanghai must I use cash to pay? Can I use a credit card?
Both cash and credit cards are OK.
